message.content:
cs.DM, cs.FL, cs.GR, cs.LO, cs.SC. 

The paper deals with algebraic models of automata and their applications in group theory and formal languages. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) which covers topics such as algebraic structures, combinatorics, and graph theory. The paper also mentions the theory of formal languages, which suggests cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) as another likely sub-category. The study of automata in group theory makes cs.GR (Group Theory) a probable sub-category. The paper also discusses decomposition theory, which is a topic covered in cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science). Finally, the paper deals with mappings of automata, which falls under cs.SC (Symbolic Computation).
